name: Claytonia
description: Claytonia, commonly known as Spring Beauty, is a genus of about 30 species of flowering plants in the family Montiaceae, native to the Americas and Asia.They come in various shapes and forms, with both annual and perennial species. The flowers are usually five-petalled and come in shades of white, pink, purple and red. Their natural habitat is woodland, so they enjoy filtered sunlight. Some species are edible and taste really good!
meaning: The genus was named after John Clayton (1694 â€“ 1773), a Virginian botanist and plant collector during the Colonial period. These flowers are among the first to bloom in spring, hence the common name.
color_description: The flowers come in shades of white, pink, purple and red.
